TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit AbstractPreferences extends Java.Util.Prefs.Preferences

Docs.summary: This abstract class is a partial implementation of the abstract class Preferences, which can be used to simplify Preferences provider's implementation.

remarks.para: This abstract class is a partial implementation of the abstract class Preferences, which can be used to simplify Preferences provider's implementation. This class defines nine abstract SPI methods, which must be implemented by a preference provider.

To be added.

remarks.para: Constructs a new AbstractPreferences instance using the given parent node and node name.

Docs.exception: if the name contains a slash character or is empty if parent is not null.

Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

.method public hidebysig virtual instance void AddNodeChangeListener(class Java.Util.Prefs.INodeChangeListener ncl) cil managed

Docs.param: the listener to be registered.
Docs.summary: Registers a NodeChangeListener instance for this node, which will handle NodeChangeEvents.

remarks.para: Registers a NodeChangeListener instance for this node, which will handle NodeChangeEvents. NodeChangeEvents will be fired when a child node has been added to or removed from this node.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void AddPreferenceChangeListener (Java.Util.Prefs.IPreferenceChangeListener pcl);

Docs.summary: Registers a PreferenceChangeListener instance for this node, which will handle PreferenceChangeEvents.

remarks.para: Registers a PreferenceChangeListener instance for this node, which will handle PreferenceChangeEvents. PreferenceChangeEvents will be fired when a preference has been added to, removed from, or updated for this node.

.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance string[] ChildrenNamesSpi() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the names of all of the child nodes of this node or an empty array if this node has no children.

remarks.para: Returns the names of all of the child nodes of this node or an empty array if this node has no children. The names of cached children are not required to be returned.

Docs.exception: if the backing store is unavailable or causes an operation failure.

MemberSignature.Value: protected abstract Java.Util.Prefs.AbstractPreferences ChildSpi (string name);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Util.Prefs.AbstractPreferences ChildSpi(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: the name of the child preference to be returned.
Docs.summary: Returns the child preference node with the given name, creating it if it does not exist.

remarks.para: Returns the child preference node with the given name, creating it if it does not exist. The caller of this method should ensure that the given name is valid and that this node has not been removed or cached. If the named node has just been removed, the implementation of this method must create a new one instead of reactivating the removed one.
The new creation is not required to be persisted immediately until the flush method will be invoked.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void Clear ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all preferences of this node.

remarks.para: Removes all preferences of this node.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void ExportNode (System.IO.Stream ostream);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void ExportNode(class System.IO.Stream ostream) cil managed

Docs.param: the output stream to write the XML-formatted data to.
Docs.summary: Exports all of the preferences of this node to a XML document using the given output stream.

remarks.para: Exports all of the preferences of this node to a XML document using the given output stream.

This XML document uses the UTF-8 encoding and is written according to the DTD in its DOCTYPE declaration, which is the following:
<!DOCTYPE preferences SYSTEM "http://java.sun.com/dtd/preferences.dtd"> Please note that (unlike the methods of this class that don't concern serialization), this call is not thread-safe.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void ExportSubtree (System.IO.Stream ostream);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void ExportSubtree(class System.IO.Stream ostream) cil managed

Docs.param: the output stream to write the XML-formatted data to.
Docs.summary: Exports all of the preferences of this node and all its descendants to a XML document using the given output stream.

remarks.para: Exports all of the preferences of this node and all its descendants to a XML document using the given output stream.

This XML document uses the UTF-8 encoding and is written according to the DTD in its DOCTYPE declaration, which is the following:
<!DOCTYPE preferences SYSTEM "http://java.sun.com/dtd/preferences.dtd"> Please note that (unlike the methods of this class that don't concern serialization), this call is not thread-safe.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void Flush ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Flush() cil managed

Docs.summary: Forces all pending updates to this node and its descendants to be persisted in the backing store.

remarks.para: Forces all pending updates to this node and its descendants to be persisted in the backing store.
If this node has been removed, the invocation of this method only flushes this node, not its descendants.

MemberSignature.Value: protected abstract void FlushSpi ();
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void FlushSpi() cil managed

Docs.summary: Flushes changes of this node to the backing store.

remarks.para: Flushes changes of this node to the backing store. This method should only flush this node and should not include the descendant nodes. Any implementation that wants to provide functionality to flush all nodes at once should override the method .

Docs.exception: if the backing store is unavailable or causes an operation failure.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Get (string key, string deflt);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance string Get(string key, string deflt) cil managed

Docs.param: the preference key.
the default value, which will be returned if no value is mapped to the given key or no backing store is available.
Docs.summary: Gets the String value mapped to the given key or its default value if no value is mapped or no backing store is available.

remarks.para: Gets the String value mapped to the given key or its default value if no value is mapped or no backing store is available.
Some implementations may store default values in backing stores. In this case, if there is no value mapped to the given key, the stored default value is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool GetBoolean (string key, bool deflt);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool GetBoolean(string key, bool deflt) cil managed

Docs.param: the preference key.
the default value, which will be returned if no value is mapped to the given key, if the backing store is unavailable, or if the value is invalid.
Docs.summary: Gets the boolean value mapped to the given key or its default value if no value is mapped, if the backing store is unavailable, or if the value is invalid.

remarks.para: Gets the boolean value mapped to the given key or its default value if no value is mapped, if the backing store is unavailable, or if the value is invalid.
The only valid values are the String "true", which represents true and "false", which represents false, ignoring case.
Some implementations may store default values in backing stores. In this case, if there is no value mapped to the given key, the stored default value is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public override byte[] GetByteArray (string key, byte[] deflt);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance unsigned int8[] GetByteArray(string key, unsigned int8[] deflt) cil managed

Docs.param: the preference key.
the default value, which will be returned if no value is mapped to the given key, if the backing store is unavailable, or if the value is invalid.
Docs.summary: Gets the byte array value mapped to the given key or its default value if no value is mapped, if the backing store is unavailable, or if the value is an invalid string.

remarks.para: Gets the byte array value mapped to the given key or its default value if no value is mapped, if the backing store is unavailable, or if the value is an invalid string.
To be valid, the value string must be Base64-encoded binary data. The Base64 encoding is as defined in , section 6.8.
Some implementations may store default values in backing stores. In this case, if there is no value mapped to the given key, the stored default value is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual Java.Util.Prefs.AbstractPreferences GetChild (string name);

Docs.param: the name of the desired child node.
Docs.summary: Returns the child node with the specified name or null if it doesn't exist.

remarks.para: Returns the child node with the specified name or null if it doesn't exist. Implementers can assume that the name supplied to this method will be a valid node name string (conforming to the node naming format) and will not correspond to a node that has been cached or removed.

Docs.exception: if the backing store is unavailable or causes an operation failure.

To be valid, the value string must be a string that can be converted to a double by .
Some implementations may store default values in backing stores. In this case, if there is no value mapped to the given key, the stored default value is returned.

This method should not throw any exceptions but if it does, the caller will ignore the exception, regarding it as a null return value.

MemberSignature.Value: protected bool NewNode { get; set; }
.property instance bool NewNode

Docs.summary: This field is true if this node is created while it doesn't exist in the backing store.

remarks.para: This field is true if this node is created while it doesn't exist in the backing store. This field's default value is false, and it is checked when the node creation is completed, and if it is true, the node change event will be fired for this node's parent.

MemberSignature.Value: public override Java.Util.Prefs.Preferences Node (string name);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class Java.Util.Prefs.Preferences Node(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: the path name of the requested preference node.
Docs.summary: Returns the preference node with the given path name.

remarks.para: Returns the preference node with the given path name. The path name can be relative or absolute. The requested node and its ancestors will be created if they do not exist.
The path is treated as relative to this node if it doesn't start with a slash, otherwise it will be treated as an absolute path.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool NodeExists (string name);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool NodeExists(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: the path name of the preference node to query.
Docs.summary: Returns whether the preference node with the given path name exists.

remarks.para: Returns whether the preference node with the given path name exists. The path is treated as relative to this node if it doesn't start with a slash, otherwise it is treated as an absolute path.
Please note that if this node has been removed, an invocation of this node will throw an IllegalStateException unless the given path is an empty string, which will return false.

the preference value for the given key.

The string form of the value is the Base64-encoded binary data of the given byte array. The Base64 encoding is as defined in , section 6.8.

MemberSignature.Value: protected abstract void RemoveNodeSpi ();
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void RemoveNodeSpi() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes this node from the preference hierarchy tree.

remarks.para: Removes this node from the preference hierarchy tree. The caller of this method should ensure that this node has no child nodes, which means the method should invoke this method multiple-times in bottom-up pattern. The removal is not required to be persisted until after it is flushed.

Docs.exception: if the backing store is unavailable or causes an operation failure.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void Sync ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Sync() cil managed

Docs.summary: Synchronizes the data of this preference node and its descendants with the back-end preference store.

remarks.para: Synchronizes the data of this preference node and its descendants with the back-end preference store. Any changes found in the back-end data should be reflected in this node and its descendants, and at the same time any local changes to this node and descendants should be persisted.

MemberSignature.Value: protected abstract void SyncSpi ();
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void SyncSpi() cil managed

Docs.summary: Synchronizes this node with the backing store.

remarks.para: Synchronizes this node with the backing store. This method should only synchronize this node and should not include the descendant nodes. An implementation that wants to provide functionality to synchronize all nodes at once should override the method .

Docs.exception: if the backing store is unavailable or causes an operation failure.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override IntPtr ThresholdClass { get; }
.property instance native int ThresholdClass

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string ToString ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string representation of this node.

remarks.para: Returns a string representation of this node. The format is "User/System Preference Node: " followed by this node's absolute path.
